content: brain slug pattern the story of the brain slug pattern comes from halloween 2007 at 5pm on halloween night my husband and i decided we needed to go out on the town with costumes we had just finished watching all 4 seasons of futurama and i had just discovered amigurumi putting those two together i crocheted 2 brain slugs in an hour found some hair clips to fix them to our heads and out we went we didn t even have to change clothes read all instructions before beginning or crochet at your own risk supplies *1 skein red heart sport in limeade it was what i had on hand and the color matches pretty well to the cartoon one skein made nearly 3 brain slugs but i had used a bit of my skein earlier in a different amigurumi * f hook or g hook gauge isn t really important use the size hook that gives you a firm fabric * tapestry needle for weaving in ends optional supplies * white felt for the eye or you could make a spiral with some white yarn i used felt * black bead for the pupil * polyfill stuffing or stuffing of your choice rough directions i haven t tested these directions they re made from my notes and i ve never written a pattern before you have been warned this pattern is worked in spirals do not join rounds unless otherwise specified use a stitch marker to mark your rounds abbreviation explanation i used my own hybrid of writing this so let me explain when i say for example 1sc 2sc continue around it means to work 1 single_crochet in the next stitch then in the following stitch work a 2sc increase stitch and to continue in that pattern around the round body to start make magic_ring or chain 2 and single_crochet in 2nd chain from the hook r1 8 single_crochet in ring r2 1sc in next st 2sc in next increase continue around r3 repeat r4 1 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet 2 single_crochet increase continue around r5 1sc 1sc 1sc 2sc increase continue around r6- single_crochet evenly around until brain slug reaches desired length leave a marker in the last single_crochet round this will be the placement for the brain slug tentacles begin decrease rounds by working a decrease 1 single_crochet 1 single_crochet 1sc 1 single_crochet decrease continue in this manner until you have a small hole left that you can still put your hand inside stuff your brain slug with fiber filling r decrease 1 single_crochet 1 single_crochet decrease around r decrease 1sc decrease etc until the bottom is closed up fasten_off tentacles go back to the last evenly single_crochet row where you left your handy-dandy stitch marker with a new slipknot on your hook single_crochet around the post in the marked row continue to single_crochet around the posts in the marked row see special note* r2 increase each stitch around by working 2 single_crochet
